intro: Tetradymia canescens var. canescens, commonly known as the brittlestem flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, bluish-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs in the summer, producing small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. The species is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid environments.
